result.execSummary:
The defendant John W Gemeinhardt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine/costs to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 12-22-2022 and each month thereafter or penalty of civil judgment entered for non payment.

Costs to be paid with fine payment. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John W Gemeinhardt

records.addlTxt:
11:06 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. 
Defendant John W Gemeinhardt in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for John W Gemeinhardt. 
Court conducts a plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 

Court orders the following:	
Fine:  $326.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid at the rate of $50.00  per month, starting  12/22/22 and the 22nd of every month until paid in full.
Alternate:  entry of civil judgment
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

10:14 AM Defendant John W Gemeinhardt in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for John W Gemeinhardt.  Prosecuting attorney Andrea M Will in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Marchan does request more time and a plea and sentencing date. 
State does not object.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 31, 2022 at 11:00 am.

9:21 AM District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Jack Rieder. Defendant John W Gemeinhardt in court.  Attorney John Paul Marchan in court for John W Gemeinhardt. 
Atty Marchan states this is his first appearance and requests discovery in this matter.
Hearing scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Letter to defendant with attorney information

Defendant to have no contact with individuals listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.
Granted. Defendant to pay $100.00 monthly, commencing 08-01-2022. (BC)

records.addlTxt: 10:28 AM Defendant John W Gemeinhardt in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defendant requests the court appoint counsel. Defendant sworn. Court grants request, repayment at rate of $100.00 per month commencing 8/1/2022.  Defendant to report to room #112 after court today.  Hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge Bugenhagen Jr. on June 29, 2022
